title: TripMate MVP: Trip input + itinerary generator + promoted listings

requirements.text: Create the TripMate MVP user flow: allow a traveler to enter trip details (trip type: solo or group/bike gang, destination, start date, end date, optional notes/interests) and submit to generate a trip plan.

quotes: My app name is TripMate...like bike gang trip or solo trip...they can enter there destination and when they can go...we will guide they end to end.

acceptanceCriteria: A Trip Details form exists with fields: trip type, destination, start date, end date, notes/interests.
Submitting the form creates a saved Trip record in the backend and navigates to a Trip Plan view.
Trips persist across page refreshes (loaded from backend).

requirements.text: Implement an in-app “AI agent” experience as a deterministic, on-chain itinerary generator (no external LLM): generate an end-to-end plan that includes a daily schedule, suggested route description (text), suggested stay/food categories, and a packing/checklist section based on trip type and duration.

quotes: we will create a ai agent in the application.the ai agent can generate a trip plan.

acceptanceCriteria: After trip submission, a generated plan is displayed with: overview, day-by-day itinerary, route guidance text, stay suggestions, food suggestions, checklist.
Generation works offline from external AI services (no API keys required).
User can regenerate the plan after editing trip inputs.

requirements.text: Add authentication via Internet Identity and basic account model: travelers can sign in to manage their own trips; business owners can sign in to manage their own promoted listings.

quotes: we will earn by the tourist places resorts,hotel and etc...the owners can gave a money promote their buisness in our application.

acceptanceCriteria: App supports sign-in/sign-out with Internet Identity.
Authenticated users see only their own created trips and their own created business listings.
Unauthenticated users can browse public promoted listings but cannot create/edit trips or listings.

requirements.text: Create a promoted listings feature: allow business owners to create, edit, and delete promoted entries (name, category: resort/hotel/restaurant/tourist place, destination/area text, description, contact info, optional promo text). Travelers can browse and filter these listings and see them injected into trip plans as “Sponsored suggestions”.

quotes: we will earn by the tourist places resorts,hotel and etc...the owners can gave a money promote their buisness in our application.

acceptanceCriteria: Business owners have a dashboard to CRUD their listings.
Travelers can browse a listings page and filter by category and destination text.
Trip Plan view shows a “Sponsored suggestions” section populated from listings that match the destination text (simple matching is acceptable).

requirements.text: Implement backend data models and persistence in a single Motoko actor for: user profiles (role: traveler/owner), trips, generated plans, and promoted listings; include query and update methods needed by the frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to create/read/update/delete trips for the authenticated caller.
Backend exposes methods to create/read/update/delete listings for the authenticated caller, plus a public query to browse listings.
Backend stores generated plans linked to trips and returns them to the frontend.

requirements.text: Frontend UX: build a coherent navigation structure with pages for Home/Landing, Trip Planner (new trip + my trips), Trip Plan detail, Explore Promoted Listings, and Owner Dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can navigate between the main sections via a top nav or sidebar.
Trip Plan detail page is accessible from “My Trips”.
Owner Dashboard is visible only to signed-in users with owner role.

requirements.text: Visual theme requirement: apply a distinctive, consistent travel-themed UI style (avoid blue/purple) across typography, spacing, and components (e.g., earthy palette such as sand/khaki/sage with charcoal text), including a landing hero section introducing TripMate.
acceptanceCriteria: App uses a consistent non-blue/purple palette and typography scale across pages.
Landing page includes a hero section describing TripMate and a clear primary CTA to plan a trip.
Components are consistently styled using Tailwind + existing UI component library composition (no edits to immutable component sources).

requirements.text: Add static generated image assets for branding and UI (logo + simple hero illustration) and render them in the frontend from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Landing page displays the logo and hero illustration without loading them via the backend.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (compose existing UI components instead).
Use English for all user-facing UI text.
Do not integrate external AI/LLM services; the “AI agent” must be implemented as an internal deterministic planner.
Do not implement GPS/maps/geolocation features (no navigation maps or GPS tracking).
nonGoals: Integration with external booking providers (hotels, flights) or payment processing for promotions.
Third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.
Push notifications, email/SMS messaging, or real-time chat.

required: TripMate logo mark, minimal compass + location pin style, earthy palette (tripmate-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide landing hero illustration: traveler with backpack + winding road + mountains, flat vector style, earthy palette (tripmate-hero.dim_1600x600.png)

goalsToAdd: Build an MVP for TripMate: trip input, itinerary generation, and promoted listings for travel businesses.
preferencesToAdd: Use English for user-facing UI text.
Prefer an earthy travel-themed visual style (avoid blue/purple).
miscToAdd: Constraints acknowledged: no external LLM integrations; no GPS/maps/geolocation features.
